Posts.Content: Age of my Father as on date-60 Weight : 59 kg (increase during last 3 yrs. by 4 kg) Biopsy done Dec-11- Metastatic prostate cancer (spread to lymh nodes )with bone mets. PSA before orchiectomy (Dec-11) =115.80 ng/ml PSA after orchiectomy (Jan-12) =0.216 ng/ml Radiation Therapy (Mar-12) Tata Hospital Mumbai PSA stable till Jan-14 to 0.216 ng/ml then, Apr-14 rise to 0.365 ng/ml July-14 rise to 0.41 ng/ml Oct-14 rise to 0.99 ng/ml Continous dose of 1 tablet/day Bicalutamide + Anti Oxident from Last 3 Yrs. Chemotherapy: Doctor suggested not to do the chemo. 1. Please suggest what will be the next step to control the spreadness? 2. What will be the expected trend to increase the PSA or it will decrease after some time. Thanks, CA. Ganesh Bhatia +91-8888889671
Posts.Title: Sudden increase in PSA by 150%during 3 month- orchiectomy done (3 Yrs ago)

Posts.Content: Dear All, Thanks a lot for this valuable suggestions. Doctor suggested not to to Chemo due to his ill/weak health. Here, I would like to ask one more question that, Is PSA below 4.0 ng/ml to be considered as normal?? Also whether this increases in multiplication (e.g. 2 to 4, then 8,16,32,64,128 etc.) or any other base & with what kind of time gap? Thanks alot dear friends.
